term_definitions.items: Contextual information regarding a persistent ' summary-style' composition e.g.
The date at which the summary was last clinically assessed or reviewed.
A comment about the summary content review.
Details of context, relating to an Episode of care.
There is no information about presence of allergies
Does the patient in general has any allergies?
Does the patient has any conditional allergies?
Information about allergies are not important for this patient in this hospital case.
Additional information about presence of allergies
The information about presence of allergies is not important
The presence of allergies is not known
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.!
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
The status of this adverse reaction record.
The datetime that the current status was recorded.
The advere reaction appears to have resolved or has been excluded after re-challenge.
Date the at the diagnosis was made.
Date at which the adverse reaction was confirmed.
Date at which the adverse reaction was deemed to be resolved.
Date that the adverse reaction was suspected.
Date that this reaction was disproved.

A harmful or undesirable effect associated with exposure to any substance or agent, including food, plants, animals, insect stings or a medication at therapeutic doses. The range of Adverse Reactions includes both Immune mediated reactions Types I-IV (including allergies and hypersensitivities) and Non-immune mediated reactions (including pseudoallergic reactions, side effects, intolerances, drug toxicities (eg Gentamycin), drug-drug interactions, food-drug interactions, drug-disease interactions and idiosyncratic reactions).

A harmful or undesirable effect associated with exposure to any substance or agent, including food, plants, animals, insect stings or a medication at therapeutic doses. The range of Adverse Reactions includes both Immune mediated reactions Types I-IV (including allergies and hypersensitivities) and Non-immune mediated reactions (including pseudoallergic reactions, side effects, intolerances, drug toxicities (eg Gentamycin), drug-drug interactions, food-drug interactions, drug-disease interactions and idiosyncratic reactions).!
Identification of a substance, agent, or a class of substance, that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction. Coding of the substance with a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Identification of a substance, agent, or a class of substance, that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction. Coding of the substance with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

A statement about propensity for a serious reaction upon further exposure to the substance/agent identified above. Record as True if the clinician assesses that exposure to, or administration of, the substance is absolutely contraindicated.
Record any additional comments about the adverse reaction, including instructions related to future exposure or administration of the substance/agent.
**Record any additional comments about the adverse reaction, including instructions related to future exposure or administration of the substance/agent.(en)(en)
Summary about each reaction event, on a per exposure basis.

More specific identification of the substance/agent or medication trade name that is considered to be responsible for this adverse reaction event. Coding of the specific substance with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

Single word, phrase or brief description of the clinical manifestation of the adverse reaction. The values entered here can be displayed as part of the Adverse Reaction List. For example: nausea, rash. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Detailed, narrative description of the reaction, if not captured elsewhere in the patient record.
Details about the exposure to the substance/agent.

The type of reaction, as determined by the clinician. Coding of the reaction type is desirable, where possible. Examples: Immune mediated - Types I-IV (including allergy and hypersensitivity); Non-immune mediated - including pseudoallergic reaction, side effect, intolerance, drug toxicity, drug-drug interaction, food-drug interaction, drug-disease interaction and idiosyncratic reaction.
Assessment of the clinical impact of the adverse reaction on the patient.
Narrative description about exposure to the substance/agent.
Further details about exposure, including structured medication amount information.
Record of the date and/or time of the earliest or initial exposure to the substance/agent.
Degree of certainty, as assessed by clinician, that the substance/agent was the cause of the reaction.
Degree of certainty, as assessed by clinician, that the substance/agent was the cause of the reaction.
Possible to be the causative agent, but without evidence.
Likely to be the causative agent, but without evidence.
Confirmed as the causative agent, by testing or rechallenge.
Details about the reaction to the substance.
Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the reaction.
Length of duration of the reaction.
Further details about the reaction, including anatomical location.
Inclusion of any multimedia file to support the recording of the reaction event, for example, a photo of a rash or presentation with angioneurotic oedema.
Further comment about the reaction event.
Narrative description about the clinical management provided.
Further details required for reporting to regulatory bodies.
Was the adverse reaction reported to a regulatory body?
Link to the Adverse Reaction Report sent to the regulatory body.
Link to further information about about the presentation and findings that exist elsewhere in the health record, for example, presenting symptoms, examination findings, diagnosis etc.
Links to supporting clinical record information
Acts as a container for a set of archetype which represent a single date-capture screen.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
Description of the state of dress of the person at the time of weighing.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight, including shoes.
Clothing which will not add to weight significantly.
Wearing only a nappy - can add significant weight.
Comment about the measurement of weight.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body weight eg timing in menstrual cycle, timing of recent bowel motion or noting of amputation.
A snapshot summary of the vaccination record.

items.items: A snapshot summary of the vaccination record.

Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.!
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
Ali pacient na splono ima alergije?
Dodatne opombe in komentarji glede alergij.
Ali pacient ima kakrnekoli pogojne alergije?
V tem hospitalnem primeru informacje o alergijah niso pomembne za tega pacienta.
*The information about presence of allergies is not important(en)
